Syria's last embroiderers: 'I lost my home and my fields, but I always kept this bag'
description: A symbol of the country's diversity, Syrian embroidery nearly disappeared during the 13 years of civil war. Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in late 2024, a group of women led by a German woman in her 70s has been trying to keep this age-old art alive.

Women protest gender-based violence across Brazil following a series of shocking cases
description: A recent string of brutal acts of violence committed against women spurred tens of thousands of women across Brazil to take to the streets in protest on Sunday.

headline: On France's coast, far-right British activists try to stop migrant crossings
description: Since summer 2024, radical British groups have periodically traveled to the French shores of the English Channel, aiming to 'stop the boats' and protest what they describe as a migrant invasion.

headline: With 'The Voice of Hind Rajab,' Kaouther Ben Hania gives Gazans their say
description: The Tunisian director, known for her hybrid-style films, shares an emotional filmmaking experience with Palestinian actors.

headline: The lawyer suing far-right French mayors for setting up Nativity scenes
description: French courts have repeatedly ruled that installing Nativity scenes in town halls is a breach of the 1905 law separating the churches and the state. Sophie Mazas works tirelessly to ensure the principle of 'laïcité' is enforced.

When Christmas presents are secondhand: 'My sisters looked at me strangely'
description: Far from consumerist extravaganzas like 'Black Friday' or 'Cyber Monday,' some people in France prefer to turn to secondhand and recycled goods for their holiday shopping. Juggling the risks of technical failure and the fear of being seen as 'cheapskates,' they share their experiences.

headline: France opts for discretion after drones spotted above naval base
description: While other European countries have chosen to politicize suspicious flyovers of strategic infrastructure, France has remained cautious about attributing responsibility for these intrusions.

headline: 'Notre-Dame de Paris's triumph highlights the Church's uncharitable position in refusing to charge tourists'
description: Not charging the millions of visitors who flock to the Paris cathedral each year is incomprehensible when considering the dire state of public finances devoted to the conservation of France's religious heritage, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.
